page.title: 07Arts and Crafts - Radley
page.content: There are a few remaining crafts which provide people with a livelihood, but many villagers practise a variety of arts and crafts in their leisure time. Tucked away in a garden shed a man works to make violins and repair all sorts of stringed instruments. Elsewhere others design and provide visual displays for exibitions. Photography also provides a living for one and pleasure for many others. Ladies learn flower arranging of fresh and artificial flowers. There are sewing groups making various items including knitting and crochetwork to send to the local hospital and abroad. Radley Women's Institute have worked two murals depicting the village and its activities and these are now displayed in the Church and Church Room. Members also cook for the local W.I. Market.
